issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

fields.summary: user-api host shows OutOfMemoryError during S3 load testing

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
Way to reproduce is to run euca-upload-bundle command after bundling a large image.

{code}
euca-upload-bundle -m  /var/tmp/bundle-cuzTI2/windows7_nov14.img.manifest.xml -b windows-alice â€”debug  
{code}

and the operation was failing each time halfway through upload

This is the error I have seen in the terminal 

{code}
2015-01-16 11:43:37,396 DEBUG   S3 request url:    http://10.111.5.145:8773/services/objectstorage/windows-alice/windows7_nov14.img.part.118
2015-01-16 11:43:37,397 DEBUG   S3 request header: Authorization: AWS AKI2GSIRVQAE3URCBLSM:5ruU91WNEhRGNh8Oms02fRFF4xw=
2015-01-16 11:43:37,397 DEBUG   S3 request header: Content-Length: 10485760
2015-01-16 11:43:37,397 DEBUG   S3 request header: Date: Fri, 16 Jan 2015 19:43:37 -0000
2015-01-16 11:43:37,397 DEBUG   S3 request header: Host: 10.111.5.145:8773
2015-01-16 11:43:37,397 DEBUG   S3 request header: User-Agent: euca2ools/3.2.0-pre1-65-gb4d4d07 (CPython 2.6.6; Linux 2.6.32-504.1.3.el6.x86_64; x86_64) requestbuilder/0.2.3 requests/1.1.0
2015-01-16 11:43:37,397 DEBUG   S3 request header: x-amz-acl: aws-exec-read
2015-01-16 11:43:38,433 DEBUG   S3 connection error 53% |===========================================                                       |   5.36 MB   5.59 MB/s ETA:  0:00:00
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/usr/lib/python2.6/site-packages/requestbuilder/service.py", line 168, in send_request
    method, url, params, data, files, headers, auth)
  File "/usr/lib/python2.6/site-packages/requestbuilder/service.py", line 256, in __log_and_send_request
    return self.session.send(p_request, stream=True, timeout=self.timeout)
  File "/usr/lib/python2.6/site-packages/requests/sessions.py", line 374, in send
    r = adapter.send(request, **kwargs)
  File "/usr/lib/python2.6/site-packages/requests/adapters.py", line 206, in send
    raise ConnectionError(sockerr)
ConnectionError: [Errno 104] Connection reset by peer
Exception in thread Thread-119:
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/usr/lib64/python2.6/threading.py", line 532, in __bootstrap_inner
    self.run()
  File "/usr/lib64/python2.6/threading.py", line 484, in run
    self.__target(*self.__args, **self.__kwargs)
  File "/usr/lib/python2.6/site-packages/euca2ools/commands/s3/putobject.py", line 136, in try_send
    response = self.send()
  File "/usr/lib/python2.6/site-packages/requestbuilder/request.py", line 167, in send
    auth=self.auth)
  File "/usr/lib/python2.6/site-packages/requestbuilder/service.py", line 205, in send_request
    raise ClientError('connection error')
ClientError: connection error
 
/var/tmp/bundle-cuzTI2/windows7_nov14.img.part.118 100% |==================================================================================|  10.00 MB   9.92 MB/s Time: 0:00:01
euca-upload-bundle: error: connection error
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/usr/bin/euca-upload-bundle", line 6, in <module>
    euca2ools.commands.bundle.uploadbundle.UploadBundle.run()
  File "/usr/lib/python2.6/site-packages/requestbuilder/command.py", line 298, in run
    cmd.handle_cli_exception(err)
  File "/usr/lib/python2.6/site-packages/requestbuilder/request.py", line 237, in handle_cli_exception
    BaseCommand.handle_cli_exception(self, err)
  File "/usr/lib/python2.6/site-packages/requestbuilder/command.py", line 295, in run
    result = cmd.main()
  File "/usr/lib/python2.6/site-packages/euca2ools/commands/bundle/uploadbundle.py", line 77, in main
    show_progress=self.args.get('show_progress'))
  File "/usr/lib/python2.6/site-packages/euca2ools/commands/bundle/mixins.py", line 396, in upload_bundle_parts
    self.upload_bundle_file(part.filename, dest, **putobj_kwargs)
  File "/usr/lib/python2.6/site-packages/euca2ools/commands/bundle/mixins.py", line 387, in upload_bundle_file
    req.main()
  File "/usr/lib/python2.6/site-packages/euca2ools/commands/s3/putobject.py", line 126, in main
    raise self.last_upload_error
requestbuilder.exceptions.ClientError: connection error
{code}

Error seen in the logs: 

{code}
2015-01-16 11:45:06  WARN | Received a reply for absent client:  No channel to write response message: Found correlation id a4b87957-366a-4894-a705-e56b7db5d62c but no correspo
nding context. for ExceptionResponseType

        at com.eucalyptus.objectstorage.ObjectStorageGateway.doPutOperation(ObjectStorageGateway.java:393)

This is the setup information

fields.summary: euca-upload-bundle throws connection error halfway through upload

comments.body:
I could reproduce this bug while installing the Debian image  by running 

{code}
python <(curl http://internal-emis.objectstorage.cloud.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com/install-emis.py)
{code}

{code}
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/usr/lib64/python2.6/threading.py", line 532, in __bootstrap_inner
    self.run()
  File "/usr/lib64/python2.6/threading.py", line 484, in run
    self.__target(*self.__args, **self.__kwargs)
  File "/usr/lib/python2.6/site-packages/euca2ools/commands/s3/putobject.py", line 136, in try_send
    response = self.send()
  File "/usr/lib/python2.6/site-packages/requestbuilder/request.py", line 167, in send
    auth=self.auth)
  File "/usr/lib/python2.6/site-packages/requestbuilder/service.py", line 205, in send_request
    raise ClientError('connection error')
ClientError: connection error

/var/tmp/bundle-wjnHaf/debian-7-2014-06-16.raw.part.30 100% |===============================================================|  10.00 MB   9.94 MB/s Time: 0:00:01
euca-install-image: error: connection error
Process Process-3:
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/usr/lib64/python2.6/multiprocessing/process.py", line 232, in _bootstrap
    self.run()
  File "/usr/lib64/python2.6/multiprocessing/process.py", line 88, in run
    self._target(*self._args, **self._kwargs)
  File "/usr/lib/python2.6/site-packages/euca2ools/bundle/pipes/fittings.py", line 162, in _write_parts
    partinfo_mpconn.send(partinfo)
IOError: [Errno 32] Broken pipe
error writing output file

gzip: stdout: Broken pipe
Process Process-1:
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/usr/lib64/python2.6/multiprocessing/process.py", line 232, in _bootstrap
    self.run()
  File "/usr/lib64/python2.6/multiprocessing/process.py", line 88, in run
    self._target(*self._args, **self._kwargs)
  File "/usr/lib/python2.6/site-packages/euca2ools/bundle/pipes/core.py", line 231, in _create_tarball_from_stream
    tarball.close()
  File "/usr/lib64/python2.6/tarfile.py", line 1768, in close
    self.fileobj.write(NUL * (BLOCKSIZE * 2))
  File "/usr/lib64/python2.6/tarfile.py", line 465, in write
    self.__write(s)
  File "/usr/lib64/python2.6/tarfile.py", line 473, in __write
    self.fileobj.write(self.buf[:self.bufsize])
IOError: [Errno 32] Broken pipe
Exception IOError: (32, 'Broken pipe') in <bound method _Stream.__del__ of <tarfile._Stream instance at 0x26f6320>> ignored
Unable to install image that was downloaded to: 
emis-debian-7.3PZIkKIK/debian-7-2014-06-16.raw.xz
{code}
